awd_titl_txt: Chemical Synthesis of Ceramics Using Molecularly Modified   Alkoxide Precursors
awd_abstract_narration: This is a study of the synthesis and processing of novel mixed                  oxide sol-gel derived ceramics. The research involves a                         comprehensive examination of the fundamental processes controlling              the simultaneous hydrolysis of precursors, the kinetics of gelation             and gel to ceramic conversion, as well as the characterization of               the microstructure and electrical properties of the final products.             For the synthesis of the precursors the co-hydrolysis of different              alkoxides will be controlled through the modification of their                  molecular structure. The objective of studying the gelation and                 conversion processes is to establish the relationship between the               molecular structure of precursors, the structure of the resulting               gels, and the structure of the intermediate crystallites during                 conversion. A fundamental understanding of the sol-gel process will             lead to new and improved ceramics for electronic and structural                 applications.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
